availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: This richly illuminated fourteenth-century German homilary is particularly interesting for its rare bifolium of drawings bound in at the front of the book. The headgear worn by the nuns in the drawings is characteristic of Cistercensian and Premostratensian nuns in northern Germany as early as circa 1320. Evidence for dating and localization is also found in the manuscript's relationship with a second homilary in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, Bodleian Library, Ms. Douce 185). Despite minor codicological differences--page layout, textblock dimensions, and ruling--it seems likely that the two homilaries were composed as a set in one scriptorium. The drawings at the beginning of the Walters manuscript were inspired by miniatures within the book and are very similar to the style of Master of Douce 185, recently identified as a collaborator of the Willehalm Master. Although the Walters homilary lacks internal evidence for localization, it can be attributed to the lower Rhine on the basis of general affinities between work of this region and English art. The Walters homilary is stylistically close to the small ivory book illustrated with fourteen paintings of the Passion in the Victoria and Albert Museum (London, Victoria and Albert Museum, inv. no.11-1872), which has Westphalian and north German characteristics. Palette, figural drawings, the use of checkered spandrels, large ivy-leaf terminals, and ape marginalia in the Walters homilary are also close to fragments of an antiphonary from Westphalia scattered in German collections (Düsseldorf, Universitätsbibliothek, Ms. D. 37a, b, c and Hamm, Städtisches Gustav-Lübcke-Museum, Mss 5474-5476). A second group of stylistically related manuscripts can be found in a two-volume antiphonary from the Dominican nunnery of Paradise near Soest (Düsseldorf, Universitätsbibliothek, Mss. D.7 and D.9).

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Latin.

msItem.title: Homilary
msItem.note: The homilary covers the period from the vigil of Easter through Pentecost.

msItem.title: Sermon of St. Augustine
msItem.rubric: (Fol. 1v) Tam jocundam solemnitatem tam miram veri luminis claritatem tam splendidam gratiae celsitudinem omnis lexus agnoscere omnis aetas in mente habere omnis debet conditio suscipere. Nescire enim
msItem.note: The rubric repeats the lines that terminate the Sermon of St. Augustine on fol. 23r. The verses are also found in chapter 27 of Rupert of Deutz's De Divinis Officiis.

msItem.title: Gospel of Matthew, ch. 28, verse 1 and forward

title.note: The Gospel Lesson for the vigil of Easter, at Mass

msItem.rubric: In sacratissima vigilia pasche ad mensam. Lectio sancti evangellii secundum Mattheum
msItem.incipit: In illo tempore vespere autem sabbati quae Lucescit
msItem.note: Only chap. 28, verse 1 is given, ending "sepulchrum et reliqua" on fol. 3v

msItem.rubric: Omelia venerabilis Bede presbiteri de eadem lectione
msItem.incipit: Vigilias nobis huius sacratissime noctis sicut ex lectione

msItem.title: Homily
msItem.incipit: Domini nostri ihesu christi honorabilem solempnitatem sua favente

msItem.incipit: Dominus noster immolatus, sabbato quievit in sepulchro

msItem.title: Homily
msItem.incipit: Sabbatum sanctum post profundam tristiciae noctem, diescit nobis

msItem.title: Homily
msItem.incipit: Dicendum nobis est quod vel quibus

support.p: Finely prepared parchment ranges from thin to thick; cropped on all three outer edges; sometimes lower margin cut off; several holes and stitches visible

supportDesc.foliation: Flyleaves not original; probably made of sixteenth-century paper, as is pastedown on each end; modern pencil foliation upper right corners, rectos

handDesc.handNote: Large and well-separated Gothic textualis of a style fashionable in the late thirteenth century

decoDesc.decoNote: This bifolium with drawings is a later addition to the manuscript. Fol. 1r, historiated initial "D," 9 lines. The initial ends with a dragon tail; St. Mark holds a book standing on a lion; it is based on the initial at fol. 24r. Fol. 1v, historiated initial "D," 8 lines. The initial has a dragon tail and leaves. St. Gregory seated holds a book on his lap and bestows a blessing with his right hand; the figure of the saint is adapted form the illumination at fol. 24v. Fol. 2r, Virgin holding the Child on her left arm and a globe in her right hand under a baldachin; the illumination is based on fol. 23r. Fol. 2v represents the Resurrection. Christ steps out of the sepulcher holding the banner on his left hand while blessing with his right. Two angels remove the lid of the grave while a third angel holding a censer flies on Christ's right. In front of the grave, four soldiers are sleeping. On the left margin of the page, nuns pray under an architecture while looking at the scene. The illumination is based on those at fols. 23v and 46r.
Full-page illumination, fol. 21r; historiated initial "D," fol. 21v; column miniature, fol. 23r
Full-page miniature, fol. 23v; historiated initial "I," fol. 24r
Prefatory miniatures, fol 45r-45v; historiated initial "H," fol. 46r
Historiated initial with Christ in Majesty, fol. 97v
Fol. 154r: One one-column illumination; one historiated initial Q
One illumination and one decorated initial "A," fol. 258v

In addition to four drawings now bound in at the front of the book, the manuscript contains four full-page miniatures, one of one-column width, six smaller miniatures set into the text, and twenty-four historiated initials of varying size, some of them filling most of a page. The manuscript also contains fifty decorated initials and versals in red and blue with filigree penwork, as well as red rubrics. Fols. 4r-99v contain band borders around three or four sides of each page and in the intercolumniation. The grounds are decorated in gold or blue with delicate foliate patterns: palmette, vines with profile leaves or ivy, dragons with vine tails, rosettes and other patterns. Fols. 20r and 51r are decorated with hart hunts, fol. 22 v with oak leaves, and fol. 62v with battling apes. Fols. 4r-11r are decorated with trilobed arches with turrets; fols. 11v, 52r-59v are decorated with round gold arches with turrets; fols. 68r-83v and fols. 92r-99v are decorated with round red and olive arches with turrets. Part of an illuminated leaf has been cut into strips and used to reinforce the joint of the binding. The strip has been removed from the binding and now is housed in the manuscript's box.

decoNote.title: Portrait of the Evangelist Matthew
decoNote.note: Homily of the Venerable Bede on the Vigil of Easter
Historiated initial "V," 12 lines

Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with the Evangelist Matthew. Matthew is depicted seated while he is writing his gospel, which is open on a lectern. At the bottom of the page, long slender tendrils extensions in the margins, populated by a dog chasing a rabbit, end in windmill patterns and gold diamond shapes.

decoNote.title: Portrait of the Venerable Bede
decoNote.note: Homely of the Venerable Bede on the Vigil of Easter
Historiated initial "V," 14 lines

Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with the Venerable Bede. Bede is portrayed seated while reading an open book on a lectern in front of him. Long slender tendril extensions in the margins end in ivy leaves.

decoNote.title: Saint Carrying the Palm of Martyrdom
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on the Resurrection
Historiated initial "D," 8 lines
A saint holds the palm of martyrdom in his left hand while gesturing with his right.

decoNote.title: The Entombment of Christ
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on the Resurrection
Historiated initial "D," 8 lines

Blue initial on cross-hatched ground with the entombment of Christ. Joseph of Arimathea and Mary Magdalene lower Christ's body on the sepulcher. Nicodemus rubs the body of Christ with spices, while Mary and St. John mourn.

decoNote.title: An Apostle with Cross
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on the Resurrection
Historiated initial "S," 9 lines
Blue initial in the shape of a dragon with a human head on cross-hatched ground. An apostle stands holding a cross with the left hand and bestowing a blessing with his right

decoNote.title: Harrowing of Hell
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on the Resurrection
Full-page illumination
Christ rescues a crowd of souls from a large toothed hell mouth

decoNote.title: Bishop Blessing
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter
Historiated intial "D," 10 lines
Bishop wearing a tiara and standing while holding a pastoral staff in his left hand

decoNote.title: Virgin and Child
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter
Single column full-page miniature
Virgin standing under a baldachin and holding the Child on her left arm and a globe in her right hand

decoNote.title: The Resurrection
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter
Full-page illumination
Christ steps out of the grave, around which two guards seated on the ground sleep; Christ holds the banner of the Resurrection in his left hand and bestows a blessing with his right

decoNote.title: Evangelist Mark
decoNote.note: Reading on the Gospel of Mark
Historiated initial "M," 9 lines
Blue initial on cross-hatched ground. Saint Mark, lion-headed, stands and points to an open book. The initial "M" has the shape of a dragon with long tail.

decoNote.title: Bishop with an Open Book
decoNote.note: Homely of St. Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Historiated intial "M," 8 lines
Blue initial on cross-hatched ground. A bishop wearing a tiara stands while blessing with his right hand and holding an open book with his left. The initial "M" is formed by a dragon with long tail.

decoNote.title: St. John the Evangelist
decoNote.note: Homely of St. Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Historiated initial "Q," 7 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground. St. John the Evangelist holds a goblet in his draped left hand while pointing with his right. The letter "Q" has a dragon-shaped tail

decoNote.title: St. Peter
decoNote.note: Homely of St. Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Historiated initial "Q," 7 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground. St. Peter stands holding the keys in his right hand. The letter "Q" ends in a dragon-shaped tail

decoNote.title: Initial "S" (Sed cum iudei)
decoNote.note: Homely of Saint Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Decorated initial "S," 5 lines
Tendrils, clover, and ivy leaves adorn the curve of the letter "S."

decoNote.title: Two Apostles
decoNote.note: Homily of St. Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Two square miniatures, 1 column wide and 15 lines high

Two apostles standing; one (probably to be identified with John) holds a book in his left hand and gestures with his right; the other (probably James) wears a scallop-shell clasp at the neck, holds a book in his right hand, and grasps a staff in his left.

decoNote.title: Three Marys at the Tomb, Noli me Tangere, and St. John the Baptist
decoNote.note: Homely of St. Gregory on the Gospel of Mark
Full-page miniature in two registers

On the upper register of the miniature, the Three Marys approach and gesture toward an angel seated on the rim of the sepulcher. The angel holds a staff in his left hand and gestures toward the Three Marys with his right. On the lower register, Mary Magdalene kneels in front of the Resurrected Jesus, who stands in a landscape gesturing with his right hand toward Mary and holding the end of a shovel in his left. In the right compartment, John the Baptist stands and holds a cross-globe with a representation of the lamb of Revelation in his draped left hand, while pointing to it with his right hand.

decoNote.title: The Crucifixion
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter
Historiated single-column initial "P"

Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground. The bowl of the "P" contains the figure of Christ crucified on the cross. The letter continues in long tendrils in the left and bottom margins of the page. The left margin of the page, near the stem of the "P," contains marginalia with an ape shooting an arrow at an owl; on the tendril at the bottom of the page, two apes are battling; one is holding a shield and a club; the other is holding a spear and a shield while riding a creature.

decoNote.title: Bishop Blessing
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Maximus of Turin on Easter
Historiated initial "N," 11 lines

Blue initial on cross-hatched ground. A bishop standing and wearing a tiara, holds a staff in his left hand and blesses with his right. The letter ends in tendril tails decorated with oak leaves and acorns.

decoNote.title: St. Paul with Sword and Book
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter
Historiated initial "N," 9 lines

Blue and red initial on a pink ground. St. Paul standing holds a book in his left hand and a sword in his right. The arch of the initial has a dragon head, and it continues in long tendrils ending in ivy leaves and gold diamonds at the corners and the center bottom margin. On the right margin of the page, an archer takes aim at a creature (probably a bird) that has been cropped out.

decoNote.title: Saint or Apostle
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter Sunday
Illumination, 7 lines
Saint or apostle stands and holds a book in his left hand while pointing at it with his right

decoNote.title: Christ Meeting Two Disciples before the Gate of Emmaus; The Doubting of Thomas
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on Easter Sunday
Full-page miniature on two registers

On the upper register, Christ stands among two disciples and gestures in an act of speech; the disciple at Christ's right is holding a book. On the right of the composition, the door of the city of Emmaus opens. On the lower register, Christ stands at the center of the scene, raising his right arm. On Christ's right, Thomas extends his right hand and probes Christ's wound. The apostles, divided into two groups of five, surround Christ.

decoNote.title: The Resurrection
decoNote.note: Sermon of Saint Augustine on Easter
Full-page initial "N"

Blue and red initial on pink cross-hatched ground. Christ steps out the grave holding the banner of the resurrection in his left hand. Two sleeping soldiers sit at the right and left of the grave. The bow of the "N" has the shape of a winged dragon. In the margins of the page, tendrils end in ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Deus propter)
decoNote.note: Feria Tertia
Decorated initial "D," 4 lines
Golden initial on blue ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Cristus paganis)
decoNote.note: Feria Quarta
Decorated initial "C," 5 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, ivy leaves, and lilies

decoNote.title: Initial "U" (Ut ortus)
decoNote.note: Feria Sexta
Decorated initial "U," 6 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "P" (Populus dei)
decoNote.note: On the Octave of Easter
Decorated initial "P," 12 lines
Golden initial on pink and blue checkered ground ornamented with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "S" (Samson media)
decoNote.note: Feria Sexta
Decorated initial "S," 5 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "F" (Fertur quod)
decoNote.note: Feria Tertia
Decorated initial "F," 12 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and clover leaves

decoNote.title: The Supper at Emmaus
decoNote.note: Full-page historiated initial "P"

Blue and red initial on pink cross-hatched ground with the Supper at Emmaus. Christ sits at the center of the table flanked by two disciples. The table is pictured in an architectural structure and has a white tablecloth. In the margins of the initial, tendrils end in ivy leaves. On the initial's stem, an ape aims at an owl with bow and arrow.

decoNote.title: An Abbot
decoNote.note: Illumination, 11 lines
Tonsured abbot standing and holding a staff in his left hand while blessing with his right

decoNote.title: The Nativity
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Maximus of Turin on Easter
Large historiated initial "E"

Large blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with the Nativity. The Virgin lying in bed holds the Child, while Joseph sits at her left on a rock and sleeps. At the left of the Virgin, the ox and the ass stand in a cave behind the manger. Below the Virgin's bed, a shepherd plays a bagpipe while watching his sheep. Tendrils extend from the letter and decorate the right margin of the page.

decoNote.title: Initial "P" (Pascha nostrum)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "P," 12 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "R" (Resurrectio domini)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine on the Resurrection of Christ according to the Gospel of Luke
Decorated initial "R," 10 lines
Golden initial on pink and blue ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Decorated initial "H," 9 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and lilies

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hodie possumus)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine. Feria tertia
Decorated initial "H," 11 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, oak leaves, acorns, and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "R" (Resurrectio)
decoNote.note: Decorated initial "R," 10 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, oak and ivy leaves, and acorns

decoNote.title: Initial "B" (Bis in sancto)
decoNote.note: Feria Quarta
Decorated initial "B," 7 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Christ in Majesty
decoNote.note: Historiated initial "H" framing the whole page with Christ in Majesty

Blue and red initial on pink cross-hatched ground. Christ in Majesty sits on a rainbow in a mandorla blessing. He holds an open book in his right hand and bestows a blessing with his left. The Virgin and John the Baptist kneel respectively on the right and left side. A tendril with a pinwheel and an owl decorate the bottom margin of the page.

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Dilectum in lectulo)
decoNote.note: Feria Quinta
Decorated initial "D," 11 lines
Golden initial on pink and blue ground decorated with tendrils, ivy and clove leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Cantate domino)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "C," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "F" (Filius accrescens)
decoNote.note: Feria Sexta. Sermon of Peter Lombard
Decorated initial "F," 15 lines
Golden initial on pink and blue ground with tendrils, ivy, and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "P" (Pascha Christi)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "P," 11 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Cristus resurgens)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Ornamented initial "C," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, ivy leaves, and lilies

decoNote.title: Ornamented initial "U" (Una sabbati)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "U," 10 lines
Golden ornamented initial on blue and pink ground with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Domini nostri)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "D," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, ivy leaves, and clovers

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Divine auctoritatis)
decoNote.note: On the Celebration of Easter before the Equinox
Decorated initial "D," 6 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "S" (Sacer ecclesie)
decoNote.note: On the Station of Easter Day after the Procession
Decorated initial "S," 5 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "T" (Totum diei)
decoNote.note: On the Office of Easter Day
Decorated initial "T," 5 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground with tendrils and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "R" (Recte ac laudabiliter)
decoNote.note: On the Holy Mary
Decorated initial "R," 5 lines
Golden initial on pink and blue checkered ground decorated with tendrils ad ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Comedi favum)
decoNote.note: Prayer of Saturday
Decorated initial "C," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue an pink ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: King David Enthroned; The Doubting of Thomas
decoNote.note: On the Octave of Easter
Illumination, 6 lines; historiated initial "Q," 10 lines

King David enthroned holds a beast-headed psaltery in his left hand and a long blank scroll curling into the margin in his right hand. A blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground contains the doubting of Thomas. Two apostles stand behind Thomas, while he puts his right finger in Christ's wound. In the right margin, the initial continues in a large dragon tail with wings that ends in a windmill shape.

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 10 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Domine noster)
decoNote.note: Prayer of the Saturday
Decorated initial "D," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "L" (Lupus venit)
decoNote.note: On the second Sunday after Easter
Decorated initial "L," 7 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with a tetragonal geometric shape, tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 9 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground decorated with tendrils and oak and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "R" (Revertere similis)
decoNote.note: On the Third Saturday after Easter
Decorated initial "R," 7 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, ivy and clove leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 8 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with a tetragonal motif, tendrils, lilies, and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "A" (Ante sex)
decoNote.note: Song on the prayer of Saturday?
Decorated initial "A," 9 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, ivy, and clover leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 10 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground ornamented with tendrils and lilies

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: On the Fourth Sunday after Easter
Decorated initial "H," 9 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink checkered ground decorated with tendrils, clover, and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "M" (Magnum et)
decoNote.note: Song on the Prayer of Saturday
Decorated initial "M," 7 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground decorated with tendrils and clover and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 11 lines
Golden initial on blue and pink ground decorated with tendrils and lilies

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "H," 9 lines
Blue initial on pink ground decorated with gray and red interlaces forming two tetragonal shapes

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hec est)
decoNote.note: Bishop Maximus
Decorated initial "H," 10 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground. The arch of the letter "H" has a dragon shape and ends in a pinwheel

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Certum est)
decoNote.note: Bishop Maximus
Decorated initial "C," 10 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "P" (Post beatam)
decoNote.note: Sermon of Pope Leo on the Ascension
Decorated initial "P," 11 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with tendrils and ivy leaves. Two female figures occupy the top and bottom of the bar forming the letter "P"; the one at the top wears a crown.

decoNote.title: Initial "S" (Sacramentum dilectissimi)
decoNote.note: Sermon of Pope Leo on the Ascension
Decorated initial "S," 10 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "O" (Omnes gentes)
decoNote.note: Prayer on the Ascension
Decorated initial "O," 5 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "D" (Postquam locutus)
decoNote.note: On the Ascension
Decorated initial "D," 7 lines
Blue initial on pink ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves. On the upper margin of the page, the tendril forms a pinwheel.

decoNote.title: Initial "F" (Fratres carissimi)
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Decorated initial "F," 10 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with tendrils and ivy leaves. The stem of the letter "F" continues on the lower margin of the page and ends in ivy leaves

decoNote.title: The Ascension
decoNote.note: Sermon of St. Augustine
Historiated initial "F," 10 lines

Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with the Ascension. The Virgin and Saint Peter with a group of Apostles flank a tall hill. They look at Christ disappearing in a cloud. Christ's feet and a wounded hand are visible. The stem of the "F" has a winged dragon shape with a lion head and ends in a tendril with ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hodie sedenti)
decoNote.note: Abbot Bernhard
Decorated initial "H," 11 lines
Blue initial on pink ground. At the center, a rhomboid shape on blue and pink ground decorated with golden dots, tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: Initial "P" (Post illum)
decoNote.note: Prayer for the Ascension
Decorated initial "P," 12 lines

Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with tendrils and ivy leaves. The stem of the letter "P" continues on the bottom of the page, forming tendrils on which are represented two apes battling with a stick.

decoNote.title: Initial "C" (Comedite amici)
decoNote.note: Prayer on the Vigil of Pentecost
Decorated initial "C," 10 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground decorated with tendrils and ivy leaves

decoNote.title: The Pentecost and Initial "A" (Audistis fratres)
decoNote.note: On the Day of Pentecost
Illumination, 9 lines; decorated initial, 10 lines

Illumination with the Pentecost. The Virgin at the center is flanked by apostles, while the Dove of the Holy Spirit descends above her. Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground decorated with tendrils, ivy leaves, and a man with a bow shooting an arrow at an ape ringing bells

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hodie dilectissimi)
decoNote.note: Sermon of Bernhard on the Pentecost
Decorated initial "H," 11 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with tendrils and ivy leaves. The curve of the letter "H" has a dragon shape. Inside the letter, two apes play a rebec (above) and bells (below)

decoNote.title: Initial "H" (Hodie sollempnitatem)
decoNote.note: Sermon of Abbot Bernhard on the Pentecost
Decorated initial "H," 7 lines
Blue initial on pink cross-hatched ground with tendrils and ivy leaves. The curve of the "H" has a large dragon shape with wings and a windmill tail.

decoNote.title: Initial "I" (Inebriamini igitur)
decoNote.note: Prayer on the Day of Pentecost
Decorated initial "I," 13 lines
Golden initial decorated with tendrils, apes, and two crowned female bust figures on the stem of the initial

binding.p: German sixteenth-century alum-tawed white pigskin, blind tooled over wood boards; back: four upper raised bands; blue and white headbands; each cover is ruled by triple fillets to form a rectangular disposition of frames and fillets around a central rectangle; the areas are filled with a close series of stamped impressions; strips decorated with vegetal motives alternate with impressed stamps; page edges painted in red; two brass catches

origin.origDate: First half of the 14th century CE

history.provenance: Léon Gruel and Robert Engelmann, Paris, late nineteenth-early twentieth century, no. 139
Henry Walters, Baltimore, purchased from Gruel and Engelmann before 1931
history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters' bequest
